intro: Babingtonia cunninghamii, commonly known as the pink hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are arranged in spikes and bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Babingtonia cunninghamii is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
